+_**User (2025-12-09 21:55Z)**_%0A%0AYou are an AI assistant tasked with completing Mini Project 3 for a Ride-Hailing Display/Dashboard at Sky Harbor Airport in Phoenix. Your responsibilities include setup, development, and documentation. Follow these instructions step by step:%0A%0A%0A%0A### Step 1. Asset Migration & Setup%0A%0A- Create a folder named %60assets%60 in the root directory.%0A%0A- Copy the following from Mini Project 2 into %60assets/%60:%0A%0A  - map.png%0A%0A  - ride_hailing.xlsx%0A%0A  - plates/ folder%0A%0A- Create a %60.gitignore%60 file in the root with exclusions for:%0A%0A  - node_modules/%0A%0A  - .env files%0A%0A  - .DS_Store%0A%0A  - Python cache files (__pycache__, *.pyc)%0A%0A### Step 2. Workspace Configuration%0A%0A- Create two folders: %60frontend/%60 and %60backend/%60.%0A%0A- Enforce strict role separation:%0A%0A  - **Frontend (UI/UX Specialist):** Work only in %60frontend/%60. Build responsive, visually appealing interface using assets. Do not touch backend code.%0A%0A  - **Backend (Technical Lead):** Work only in %60backend/%60. Handle logic, data processing of ride_hailing.xlsx, and API routing. Do not touch frontend code.%0A%0A### Step 3. Feature Implementation%0A%0AEnhance the project with two meaningful new features:%0A%0A1. **Terminal-aware pickup guidance**%0A%0A   - Map each terminal (3 and 4) to pickup zones.%0A%0A   - Display walking times and live ETA/availability.%0A%0A   - Show a banner: %E2%80%9CFrom Terminal X: Head to Zone Y. Pickup in Z minutes.%E2%80%9D%0A%0A2. **Price + wait forecast (15%E2%80%9330 min horizon)**%0A%0A   - Use rolling averages and slope to forecast surge pricing and wait times.%0A%0A   - Display trend badges (up/down/flat) with color coding.%0A%0A   - Provide compact sparkline or capsule view.%0A%0A### Step 4. Development Workflow%0A%0A- Use role-specific prompts when generating code:%0A%0A  - Frontend prompt: %E2%80%9CI am the UI/UX designer. I am only working in the frontend/ directory. Do not generate or modify any code in the backend folder. Focus on creating a responsive and visually appealing interface using the assets in the assets folder.%E2%80%9D%0A%0A  - Backend prompt: %E2%80%9CI am the Technical Lead. I am only working in the backend/ directory. Do not generate UI code. Focus on the logic to process ride_hailing.xlsx inside the assets folder and handle data routing.%E2%80%9D%0A%0A- Commit and push after each working feature:%0A%0A  - Example commit messages: %E2%80%9Cfeat: add terminal tabs and guidance banner%E2%80%9D, %E2%80%9Cfeat(backend): implement forecast endpoint%E2%80%9D, %E2%80%9Cstyle: improve responsive grid%E2%80%9D.%0A%0A%0A%0A### Deliverables%0A%0A- Functional frontend and backend folders with implemented features.%0A%0A- Assets folder with migrated files.%0A%0A- .gitignore file.%0A%0A- GitHub repo with clear commit history.%0A%0AYour output should be structured, complete, and executable. Respect folder boundaries. Do not overwrite partner%E2%80%99s work. Always commit after feature completion.%0A%0A%0A%0A---%0A%0A_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_%0A%0A%0A%0A---%0A%0A%0AExploring the repository structure and locating Mini Project 2 assets.%0A%0A%0A---%0A%0A%3Ctool-use data-tool-type=%22generic%22 data-tool-name=%22list_dir%22%3E%0A%3Cdetails%3E%0A            %3Csummary%3ETool use: **list_dir** %E2%80%A2 Listed directory undefined %E2%80%A2 **0** results%3C/summary%3E%0A        %0ANo results found%0A%3C/details%3E%0A%3C/tool-use%3E%0A%0A---%0A%0A%3Ctool-use data-tool-type=%22read%22 data-tool-name=%22read_file%22%3E%0A%3Cdetails%3E%3Csummary%3ETool use: **read_file** %E2%80%A2 Read file: /Users/felixisaac123/Desktop/MiniProject3/mini-project-3-team-tiger/README.md%3C/summary%3E%0A%0A%3C/details%3E%0A%3C/tool-use%3E%0A%0A---%0A%0A%3Ctool-use data-tool-type=%22shell%22 data-tool-name=%22run_terminal_cmd%22%3E%0A%3Cdetails%3E%3Csummary%3ETool use: **run_terminal_cmd** %E2%80%A2 Run command: find /Users/felixisaac123/Desktop -name %22MiniProject2%22 -o -name %22mini-project-2*%22 -type d 2%3E/dev/null %7C head -5%3C/summary%3E%0A%0A%60%60%60bash%0Afind /Users/felixisaac123/Desktop -name %22MiniProject2%22 -o -name %22mini-project-2*%22 -type d 2%3E/dev/null %7C head -5%0A%60%60%60%0A%3C/details%3E%0A%3C/tool-use%3E%0A%0A---%0A%0A%0A%0A---%0A%0A

location%0A+     %7D%0A+ %7D%0A+ %0A+ # Load and cache data%0A+ def load_data():%0A+     %22%22%22Load ride hailing data from Excel file%22%22%22%0A+     try:%0A+         df = pd.read_excel(DATA_FILE,         return pd.DataFrame()%0A+ %0A+ # Global data cache%0A+ _data_cache = None%0A+ %0A+ def get_data():%0A+     %22%22%22Get cached data or load fresh%22%22%22%0A+     global _data_cache%0A+     if Get latest timestamp%0A+     latest_time = df%5B'current_time'%5D.max()%0A+     current_data = df%5Bdf%5B'current_time'%5D == latest_time%5D.copy()%0A+     %0A+     # Filter active slots (with valid positions)%0A+     active_slots = current_data%5B%0A+         current_data%5B'x'%5D.notna() & current_data%5B'y'%5D.notna()%0A+     %5D.copy()%0A+     %0A+     result = %7B%0A+         'timestamp': latest_time.isoformat(),%0A+         'total_slots': len(current_data),%0A+         'active_slots': len(active_slots),%0A+         'slots': active_slots.to_dict('records')%0A+     %7D%0A+     %0A+     return jsonify(result)%0A+ %0A+ @app.route('/api/terminal/guidance', methods=%5B'GET'%5D)%0A+ def get_terminal_guidance():%0A+     %22%22%22Get terminal-aware pickup guidance%22%22%22%0A+     terminal = request.args.get('terminal', 'Terminal 3')%0A+     %0A+     if terminal not in TERMINAL_ZONES:%0A+         return jsonify(%7B'error': f'Terminal %7Bterminal%7D not found'%7D), 400%0A+     %0A+     terminal_info = TERMINAL_ZONES%5Bterminal%5D%0A+     df = get_data()%0A+     %0A+     if df.empty:%0A+         return jsonify(%7B'error': 'No data available'%7D), 500%0A+     %0A+     # Get latest timestamp%0A+     latest_time = df%5B'current_time'%5D.max()%0A+     current_data = df%5Bdf%5B'current_time'%5D == latest_time%5D.copy()%0A+     %0A+     # Filter active slots in the terminal's zone%0A+     zone_coords = terminal_info%5B'pickup_coords'%5D%0A+     zone_x, zone_y = zone_coords%5B'x'%5D, zone_coords%5B'y'%5D%0A+     %0A+     # Find nearest available slots (within reasonable distance)%0A+     active_slots = current_data%5B%0A+         current_data%5B'x'%5D.notna() & current_data%5B'y'%5D.notna()%0A+     %5D.copy()%0A+     %0A+     if len(active_slots) > 0:%0A+         # Calculate distances to zone%0A+         active_slots%5B'distance'%5D = np.sqrt(%0A+             (active_slots%5B'x'%5D - zone_x)**2 + (active_slots%5B'y'%5D - zone_y)**2%0A+         )%0A+         # Find nearest available slot%0A+         nearest_slot = active_slots.loc%5Bactive_slots%5B'distance'%5D.idxmin()%5D%0A+         %0A+         # Estimate ETA (walking time + wait time)%0A+         # Wait time based on number of available slots (more slots = less wait)%0A+         available_count = len(active_slots)%0A+         estimated_wait_minutes = max(2, 10 - (available_count // 5))  # Simple heuristic%0A+         %0A+         total_minutes = terminal_info%5B'walking_time_minutes'%5D + estimated_wait_minutes%0A+         %0A+         result = %7B%0A+             'terminal': terminal,%0A+             'zone': terminal_info%5B'zone'%5D,%0A+             'walking_time_minutes': terminal_info%5B'walking_time_minutes'%5D,%0A+             'estimated_wait_minutes': estimated_wait_minutes,%0A+             'total_minutes': total_minutes,%0A+             'available_slots': len(active_slots),%0A+             'nearest_slot_id': int(nearest_slot%5B'slot_id'%5D),%0A+             'message': f%22From %7Bterminal%7D: Head to %7Bterminal_info%5B'zone'%5D%7D. Pickup in %7Btotal_minutes%7D minutes.%22%0A+         %7D%0A+     else:%0A+         result = %7B%0A+             'terminal': terminal,%0A+             'zone': terminal_info%5B'zone'%5D,%0A+             'walking_time_minutes': terminal_info%5B'walking_time_minutes'%5D,%0A+             'estimated_wait_minutes': 15,  # Default if no slots%0A+             'total_minutes': terminal_info%5B'walking_time_minutes'%5D + 15,%0A+             'available_slots': 0,%0A+             'message': f%22From %7Bterminal%7D: Head to %7Bterminal_info%5B'zone'%5D%7D. Pickup in %7Bterminal_info%5B'walking_time_minutes'%5D + 15%7D minutes.%22%0A+         %7D%0A+     %0A+     return jsonify(result)%0A+ %0A+ @app.route('/api/forecast/price-wait', methods=%5B'GET'%5D)%0A+ def get_price_wait_forecast():%0A+     %22%22%22Get price and wait time forecast (15-30 min horizon)%22%22%22%0A+     df = get_data()%0A+     %0A+     if df.empty:%0A+         return jsonify(%7B'error': 'No data available'%7D), 500%0A+     %0A+     # Get latest timestamp%0A+     latest_time = df%5B'current_time'%5D.max()%0A+     %0A+     # Get data from last 30 minutes for rolling average%0A+     time_window = timedelta(minutes=30)%0A+     historical_data = df%5Bdf%5B'current_time'%5D >= (latest_time - time_window)%5D.copy()%0A+     %0A+     # Calculate metrics over time windows%0A+     time_buckets = %5B%5D%0A+     for i in range(6):  # 6 buckets of 5 minutes each = 30 minutes%0A+         bucket_start = latest_time - timedelta(minutes=(6-i)*5)%0A+         bucket_end = latest_time - timedelta(minutes=(5-i)*5) if i < 5 else latest_time%0A+         bucket_data = historical_data%5B%0A+             (historical_data%5B'current_time'%5D >= bucket_start) & %0A+             (historical_data%5B'current_time'%5D < bucket_end)%0A+         %5D%0A+         %0A+         active_slots = bucket_data%5B%0A+             bucket_data%5B'x'%5D.notna() & bucket_data%5B'y'%5D.notna()%0A+         %5D%0A+         %0A+         # Simulate price based on demand (fewer slots = higher price)%0A+         # Base price + surge multiplier%0A+         base_price = 15.0%0A+         availability_ratio = len(active_slots) / len(bucket_data) if len(bucket_data) > 0 else 0%0A+         surge_multiplier = max(1.0, 2.0 - availability_ratio)%0A+         price = base_price * surge_multiplier%0A+         %0A+         # Wait time based on availability%0A+         wait_time = max(2, 15 - (len(active_slots) // 3))%0A+         %0A+         time_buckets.append(%7B%0A+             'time': bucket_start.isoformat(),%0A+             'price': round(price, 2),%0A+             'wait_time': wait_time,%0A+             'availability': len(active_slots)%0A+         %7D)%0A+     %0A+     # Calculate rolling averages and trends%0A+     prices = %5Bb%5B'price'%5D for b in time_buckets%5D%0A+     wait_times = %5Bb%5B'wait_time'%5D for b in time_buckets%5D%0A+     %0A+     # Rolling average (last 3 buckets)%0A+     recent_prices = prices%5B-3:%5D if len(prices) >= 3 else prices%0A+     recent_waits = wait_times%5B-3:%5D if len(wait_times) >= 3 else wait_times%0A+     %0A+     avg_price = np.mean(recent_prices)%0A+     avg_wait = np.mean(recent_waits)%0A+     %0A+     # Calculate slope/trend (linear regression on last 3 points)%0A+     if len(recent_prices) >= 2:%0A+         x = np.arange(len(recent_prices))%0A+         price_slope = np.polyfit(x, recent_prices, 1)%5B0%5D%0A+         wait_slope = np.polyfit(x, recent_waits, 1)%5B0%5D%0A+     else:%0A+         price_slope = 0%0A+         wait_slope = 0%0A+     %0A+     # Determine trend direction%0A+     def get_trend(slope, threshold=0.1):%0A+         if slope > threshold:%0A+             return 'up'%0A+         elif slope < -threshold:%0A+             return 'down'%0A+         else:%0A+             return 'flat'%0A+     %0A+     price_trend = get_trend(price_slope, threshold=0.5)%0A+     wait_trend = get_trend(wait_slope, threshold=0.5)%0A+     %0A+     # Forecast for next 15-30 minutes%0A+     forecast_horizon = 20  # minutes%0A+     forecast_price = avg_price + (price_slope * 4)  # Extrapolate%0A+     forecast_wait = avg_wait + (wait_slope * 4)%0A+     %0A+     # Ensure reasonable bounds%0A+     forecast_price = max(10.0, min(50.0, forecast_price))%0A+     forecast_wait = max(2, min(30, int(forecast_wait)))%0A+     %0A+     result = %7B%0A+         'current': %7B%0A+             'price': round(prices%5B-1%5D if prices else avg_price, 2),%0A+             'wait_time': wait_times%5B-1%5D if wait_times else int(avg_wait),%0A+             'timestamp': latest_time.isoformat()%0A+         %7D,%0A+         'forecast': %7B%0A+             'price': round(forecast_price, 2),%0A+             'wait_time': forecast_wait,%0A+             'horizon_minutes': forecast_horizon%0A+         %7D,%0A+         'trends': %7B%0A+             'price': %7B%0A+                 'direction': price_trend,%0A+                 'slope': round(price_slope, 3)%0A+             %7D,%0A+             'wait_time': %7B%0A+                 'direction': wait_trend,%0A+                 'slope': round(wait_slope, 3)%0A+             %7D%0A+         %7D,%0A+         'historical': time_buckets,%0A+         'sparkline_data': %7B%0A+             'prices': prices,%0A+             'wait_times': wait_times%0A+         %7D%0A+     %7D%0A+     %0A+     return jsonify(result)%0A+ %0A+ @app.route('/api/data/timeseries', methods=%5B'GET'%5D)%0A+ def get_timeseries_data():%0A+     %22%22%22Get time series data for visualization%22%22%22%0A+     df = get_data()%0A+     %0A+     if df.empty:%0A+         return jsonify(%7B'error': 'No data available'%7D), 500%0A+     %0A+     # Get unique timestamps%0A+     unique_times = sorted(df%5B'current_time'%5D.unique())%0A+     %0A+     # Aggregate data by timestamp%0A+     timeseries = %5B%5D%0A+     for timestamp in unique_times:%0A+         time_data = df%5Bdf%5B'current_time'%5D == timestamp%5D%0A+         active_slots = time_data%5B%0A+             time_data%5B'x'%5D.notna() & time_data%5B'y'%5D.notna()%0A+         %5D%0A+         %0A+         timeseries.append(%7B%0A+             'timestamp': timestamp.isoformat(),%0A+             'active_slots': len(active_slots),%0A+             'total_slots': len(time_data)%0A+         %7D)%0A+     %0A+     return jsonify(%7B%0A+         'timeseries': timeseries,%0A+         'total_points': len(timeseries)%0A+     %7D)%0A+ %0A+ if __name__ == '__main__':%0A+     print(%22Starting Backend API Server...%22)%0A+     print(f%22Data file: %7BDATA_FILE%7D%22)%0A+     app.run(debug=True, port=5000, host='0.0.0.0')%0A+ Date%5D(https://classroom.github.com/assets/deadline-readme-button-22041afd0340ce965d47ae6ef1cefeee28c7c493a6346c4f15d667ab976d596c.svg)%5D(https://classroom.github.com/a/0rtLjY3p)%0A+ %0A+ ## Project Overview%0A+ %0A+ This project implements a real-time ride-hailing display dashboard for Sky Harbor Airport in Phoenix, featuring terminal-aware pickup guidance and price/wait time forecasting capabilities.%0A+ %0A+ ## Features%0A+ %0A+ ### 1. Terminal-Aware Pickup Guidance%0A+ - Maps Terminals 3 and 4 to their respective pickup zones%0A+ - Displays walking times and live ETA/availability%0A+ - Shows dynamic banner: %22From Terminal X: Head to Zone Y. Pickup in Z minutes.%22%0A+ - Real-time slot availability tracking%0A+ %0A+ ### 2. Price + Wait Forecast (15-30 min horizon)%0A+ - Uses rolling averages and slope calculations to forecast surge pricing and wait times%0A+ - Displays trend badges (up/down/flat) with color coding%0A+ - Provides compact sparkline visualizations%0A+ - Historical data analysis for accurate predictions%0A+ %0A+ ## Project Structure%0A+ %0A+ ```%0A+ mini-project-3-team-tiger/%0A+ %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 assets/                 # Data and image assets%0A+ %E2%94%82   %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 map.png            # Airport map background%0A+ %E2%94%82   %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 ride_hailing.xlsx  # Ride data%0A+ %E2%94%82   %E2%94%94%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 plates/            # License plate images%0A+ %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 backend/               # Backend API (Technical Lead)%0A+ %E2%94%82   %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 app.py            # Flask API server%0A+ %E2%94%82   %E2%94%94%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 requirements.txt  # Python dependencies%0A+ %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 frontend/             # Frontend UI (UI/UX Specialist)%0A+ %E2%94%82   %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 index.html        # Main HTML page%0A+ %E2%94%82   %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 styles.css        # Responsive styling%0A+ %E2%94%82   %E2%94%94%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 app.js           # Frontend logic%0A+ %E2%94%9C%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 .gitignore           # Git exclusions%0A+ %E2%94%94%E2%94%80%E2%94%80 README.md           # This file%0A+ ```%0A+ %0A+ ## Setup Instructions%0A+ %0A+ ### Prerequisites%0A+ - Python 3.8 or higher%0A+ - pip (Python package manager)%0A+ - Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)%0A+ %0A+ ### Backend Setup%0A+ %0A+ 1. Navigate to the backend directory:%0A+    ```bash%0A+    cd backend%0A+    ```%0A+ %0A+ 2. Create a virtual environment (recommended):%0A+    ```bash%0A+    python3 -m venv venv%0A+    source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv%5CScripts%5Cactivate%0A+    ```%0A+ %0A+ 3. Install dependencies:%0A+    ```bash%0A+    pip install -r requirements.txt%0A+    ```%0A+ %0A+ 4. Start the backend server:%0A+    ```bash%0A+    python app.py%0A+    ```%0A+ %0A+    The API will be available at `http://localhost:5000`%0A+ %0A+ ### Frontend Setup%0A+ %0A+ 1. The frontend is a static HTML/CSS/JavaScript application. No build step required.%0A+ %0A+ 2. Open `frontend/index.html` in a web browser, or use a local server:%0A+ %0A+    **Option A: Python HTTP Server**%0A+    ```bash%0A+    cd frontend%0A+    python3 -m http.server 8000%0A+    ```%0A+    Then open `http://localhost:8000` in your browser.%0A+ %0A+    **Option B: VS Code Live Server**%0A+    - Install the %22Live Server%22 extension%0A+    - Right-click on `index.html` and select %22Open with Live Server%22%0A+ %0A+    **Option C: Direct File Open**%0A+    - Simply open `frontend/index.html` in your browser (note: CORS may prevent API calls)%0A+ %0A+ ## API Endpoints%0A+ %0A+ ### Health Check%0A+ - `GET /api/health` - Check API status%0A+ %0A+ ### Terminal Guidance%0A+ - `GET /api/terminal/guidance?terminal=Terminal 3` - Get pickup guidance for a terminal%0A+ %0A+ ### Forecast%0A+ - `GET /api/forecast/price-wait` - Get price and wait time forecast%0A+ %0A+ ### Data%0A+ - `GET /api/data/current` - Get current ride data%0A+ - `GET /api/data/timeseries` - Get time series data%0A+ %0A+ ## Usage%0A+ %0A+ 1. Start the backend server (see Backend Setup)%0A+ 2. Open the frontend in a browser (see Frontend Setup)%0A+ 3. Select a terminal (Terminal 3 or Terminal 4) using the tabs%0A+ 4. View the guidance banner with pickup instructions%0A+ 5. Monitor price and wait time forecasts with trend indicators%0A+ 6. Observe the live map visualization%0A+ %0A+ ## Role Separation%0A+ %0A+ This project maintains strict role separation:%0A+ %0A+ - **Backend (Technical Lead)**: All backend code is in `backend/` directory%0A+   - Data processing from `ride_hailing.xlsx`%0A+   - API routing and business logic%0A+   - Forecasting algorithms%0A+ %0A+ - **Frontend (UI/UX Specialist)**: All frontend code is in `frontend/` directory%0A+   - Responsive, visually appealing interface%0A+   - User interaction and visualization%0A+   - API integration%0A+ %0A+ ## Technologies Used%0A+ %0A+ - **Backend**: Flask, Pandas, NumPy%0A+ - **Frontend**: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (Vanilla)%0A+ - **Data**: Excel (openpyxl)%0A+ %0A+ ## Development Notes%0A+ %0A+ - The dashboard auto-updates every 5 seconds%0A+ - Terminal guidance is calculated based on nearest available slots%0A+ - Forecasts use rolling averages and linear regression for trend analysis%0A+ - Sparklines provide visual trend indicators%0A+ %0A+ ## Implemented:%0A%0A## New features%0A%0A### 1. Time-based animation%0A- Animates through all timestamps in the data%0A- Shows cars appearing and disappearing over time%0A- Displays current time above the map%0A%0A### 2. License plate images%0A- Displays license plate images for each car on the map%0A- Images are cached for performance%0A- Falls back gracefully if an image is missing%0A%0A### 3. Animation controls%0A- Play/Pause button: Start or stop the animation%0A- Slow button: Reduce speed (0.5x, 1x, 2x, 4x)%0A- Fast button: Increase speed%0A- Reset button: Jump back to the beginning%0A- Speed indicator: Shows current speed (1x, 2x, etc.)%0A%0A### 4. Backend enhancements%0A- New endpoint: %60/api/data/time/%3Ctimestamp%3E%60 - Get data for a specific time%0A- New endpoint: %60/api/data/timestamps%60 - Get all available timestamps%0A%0A## How it works%0A%0A1. On page load, the animation automatically starts playing%0A2. The map cycles through all timestamps, showing cars at each moment%0A3. License plate images are displayed for each active slot%0A4. Use the controls to pause, change speed, or reset%0A%0A## Try it%0A%0ARefresh your browser. The animation should start automatically, showing:%0A- Cars appearing and disappearing as time progresses%0A- License plate images for each car%0A- Current time displayed above the map%0A- Working speed controls%0A%0AThe animation loops continuously, so you can watch the full hour of data (6:00 PM to 6:59 PM) cycle through. Use the speed controls to slow down (0.5x) for detail or speed up (4x) for a quick overview.
